shows.title: Spy Secrets / Life Beyond Death
shows.first_half: First Half: Jason Hanson is a former CIA officer and author of "Spy Secrets That Can Save Your Life." He'll share CIA tactics such as how to vanish without a trace, how to find a safe house, the best places to disappear to, and how to make a living in your new location.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author Sandra Champlain will discuss the powerful spectrum of end-of-life phenomena that she believes prove our consciousness survives death. She'll bring us information on the lesser-known Shared Death Experience, where healthy individuals report sharing in a loved one's transition, seeing the light, and meeting spirits who've come to help.

shows.title: Ascension & ETs / Spirit Attachments & the Supernatural
shows.first_half: First Half: An authority on human spiritual transformation and ascension, investigative mythologist William Henry journeys to the edge of our reality, exploring the intersection of technology and spirituality. He'll discuss his latest research into ETs and prophecy, AI, ascension, and the countdown to disclosure.
shows.second_half: Second Half: "Queen of Darkness" Shannon Michelle Collins shares her perspective on being a paranormal investigator and living with a spirit attachment. She'll talk about her experiences in the supernatural field and the impacts on her life.

shows.title: Undercover Agent / Portal Messages
shows.first_half: First Half: Author Ian Frisch will discuss the covert world of Colombian drug cartels through the eyes of legendary FBI agent Martin Suarez. Suarez is widely regarded among FBI agents as the greatest undercover agent of all time and holds the record for the longest continuous undercover run – an astonishing 23 years.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Paranormal investigator Joshua P. Warren will update us on his work regarding how to access a portal next to Area 51, as well as his new invention, how it works, and how anyone in the world can send a message through the portal.

shows.title: Numerology Update / Neuroscience of Sci-Fi & Horror
shows.first_half: First Half: Numerologist Glynis McCants shares her numerological analysis of current events and the future, along with updates on particular numbers and patterns, and what shifts to watch out for.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Neuroscientist Austin Lim, PhD, will discuss the science behind some of the most famous works of horror and science fiction, including classics such as Frankenstein and The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, to modern masterpieces like Get Out and The Last of Us. He examines the minds of filmgoers and the impact of primal fear on them.

shows.title: Intuition & Telepathy / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Joining guest host Ryan Wrecker (email), Director of Research at the Institute of Noetic Sciences Helané Wahbeh will be discussing the science and mystery behind human intuition and telepathy, including her research on trance channeling. She'll share insights into how people uniquely experience intuitive moments and how we can strengthen these abilities. Wahbeh will also reflect on why these skills are becoming more relevant today, and what future discoveries excite her most. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give Ryan a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
